page.title: 07Notable Buildings
page.content:
{The Cater Museum} Billericay High Street
The{Cater Museum}is situated on the east side of the High Street. The museum was once a house dating from the eighteenth century. In 1959 the house was turned into a museum and shops. Inside there is a{bedroom}and a{ {sitting room}as it was in 1865. There is also an open fire{kitchen}the items in the kitchen were used up to roughly 1914. The other three{rooms, staircases and{passages}display exhibits from prehistoric times to the present day including a collection of toys and games and items relating to 'Leisure and Pleasure' interests.
